episode_summary: This episode covers a variety of intriguing topics, including the story of Iceland's only mosquito, Japan's secret propaganda underwear, the phenomenon of fish getting the bends when reeled in too quickly, and the historical practice of boxers challenging opponents through newspaper ads in 18th century London.

facts.fact: There is only one mosquito in Iceland.
In the early 20th century, Japan had secret propaganda underwear, which you would only show to your close friends or family.
Fish get the bends if you reel them in too quickly.
In 18th century London, professional boxers would challenge opponents by publishing requests to fight in the letters columns of newspapers.
